ca.gedge.opgraph.extensions
Interface Extendable

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConstantValueNode, CurrentIterationNode, ExtendableSupport, ForEachNode, GetContextValueNode, InputField, LogicalAndNode, LogicalNotNode, LogicalOrNode, LogicalXorNode, MacroNode, MathExpressionNode, MaxIterationsNode, Note, OpGraph, OpLink, OpNode, OutputField, PassThroughNode, Publishable.PublishedInput, Publishable.PublishedOutput, RandomBooleanNode, RandomDecimalNode, RandomIntegerNode, RandomStringNode, RangeNode, ScriptNode, SimpleItem
public interface Extendable

An interface for any class which would like to provide extensions to their functionality, even if the class is defined as final.

Method Summary
<T> T
getExtension(Class<T> type)
          Gets the extension of a given type.
 Collection<Class<?>> getExtensionClasses()
          Gets an iterable copy of the extensions.
<T> T
putExtension(Class<T> type, T extension)
          Adds or removes an extension of a specified type to an extendable.
 

Method Detail

getExtension

<T> T getExtension(Class<T> type)
Gets the extension of a given type.

Parameters:
type - the type of extension to get
Returns:
an instance of that extension type, or null if the specified extension type is not supported by the class.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if type is null

getExtensionClasses

Collection<Class<?>> getExtensionClasses()
Gets an iterable copy of the extensions.

Returns:
an iterable copy of the extensions

putExtension

<T> T putExtension(Class<T> type,
                   T extension)
Adds or removes an extension of a specified type to an extendable.

Parameters:
type - the type of extension to add
extension - the extension instance to add, or null if the extension of the specified type should be removed from this extendable
Returns:
the old extension instance of the specified type, or null if one did not previously exist
Throws:
NullPointerException - if type is null
